attributes.additional_details:
Cost savings: Supporters argue that the death penalty can be more cost-effective than keeping a convicted criminal in prison for life. They claim that the expenses associated with long-term incarceration can be reduced by implementing capital punishment.
Public opinion: Proponents of the death penalty often argue that it reflects the will of the majority of the public. They believe that society has the right to demand the ultimate punishment for the most severe crimes.
attributes.background:
Supporters argue that the death penalty acts as a deterrent against serious crimes. They believe that the fear of facing capital punishment would discourage potential criminals from committing heinous acts. 
Justice and retribution Some people believe that this is the appropriate justice given
